thread.title: Rhode Island firm in running for NY State Fair contract
thread.title_full: Rhode Island firm in running for NY State Fair contract - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: Rhode Island firm in running for NY State Fair contract
text:
SYRACUSE, N.Y. (AP) - A Rhode Island-based construction company is the front-runner to oversee the $60 million in improvements planned for the New York State Fair outside Syracuse.
The Post-Standard of Syracuse reports ( http://bit.ly/1MrMqKZ ) that a state selection board has given Gilbane Building of Providence the highest score of the four companies bidding for a $4.5 million construction management contract for the overhaul of the fairgrounds in suburban Geddes.
The two-year contract must still be negotiated, then approved by the state's attorney general and comptroller before it's awarded.
The state's plans for the fairground include demolishing one concert venue and rebuilding another, building a new midway and adding a new RV park.
Gilbane's contract for the state fair is expected to be completed this fall.
Gilbane built the Lakeview Amphitheater, which opened on Onondaga Lake near the fairgrounds last month.
